SENT.plain: Head pain is one of the main presenting symptoms of internal carotid artery (ICA) dissection, usually in association with ischemic and/or local signs such as Horner's syndrome, lower cranial nerve palsies, or tinnitus
In rare cases, head pain remains isolated and mimics other conditions
We report a patient who suffered isolated prolonged orbital pain as the only sign of intrapetrous ICA dissection
Early recognition of such unusual facial pain may be crucial in decreasing the risk of secondary cerebral or retinal ischemia
